alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 2:58PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California...Nevada... West Walker River Near Little Walker and Coleville affecting Mono County. Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane affecting Lyon County. .Warm temperatures will lead to continued snowmelt and subsequent flooding along the West Fork and Mainstem of the Walker River. Diurnal crests should begin to gradually taper off through this weekend, although flooding is still anticipated. For the Main Stem Walker River, minor to moderate flooding is still forecast. Impacts to these areas will likely be prolonged, so follow advice from your local officials. For the West Walker Above Topaz Lake...including Little Walker and Coleville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Mainstem Walker River...including Mason at Snyder Lane... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is expected to continue. * WHERE...Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.8 feet, Minor flooding of lowlands...pasture and farmland adjacent to the river throughout the Mason Valley-Yerington area. Some rural roads flood. Preventative sandbagging of low structures in Mason and Yerington may be necessary as river rises, but limited flooding occurs. Some minor flooding of basements and yards in Mason. Similar level to floods of July 1 2011. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:35 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:35 PM PDT Wednesday was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.9 feet late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.8 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.9 feet on 06/22/2017. - https://www.cnrfc.noaa.gov http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 500 PM PDT.
